channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Flooded footpath in Alley behind Greenwich Post Office, 28th January
item.description:
Flooded footpath... Recent building works have left this section of footpath without any effective drainage... A drainage system is required to prevent repeated flooding after rainfall, and slip-risk when frozen in cold weather...

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Greenwich High Road, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: DANGEROUS HAZARD - Abandoned Forest eBike, 28th January
item.description:
Carelessly abandoned Forest eBike is completely blocking this pavement... these eBikes have been abandoned & dangerously discarded on this Footpath, and is deliberately blocking the Footpath... this behaviour is grossly unacceptable and dangerously anti-social... Forest eBikes are an unacceptable menace on our Footpaths - this is not only selfish, it is also dangerous... A clear and present hazard for all pedestrians, and particularly to "protected groups" in direct contravention to the Equality Act (2010)... Users must face the consequences of their selfish actions... I invite you to, please, to ban the Forest User and / or issue a £100 fine...

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Haddo Street, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Holme vale house, 28th January
item.description:
Yesterday my neighbour decided to drop the kerb for a potential driveway and take a residents bay away by altering the lines on the road. This work was carried out by the tarmac company who are working with the Thames water contractors. They were resurfacing on Branch Hill yesterday due to new pipes being laid. On further investigation no planning has been applied for to do this work. No consultation has been put in place for any of the residents parking is already tricky and limited since a bay was also taken by the council for disabled which no one uses. Please can you investigate further. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Branch Hill, West Hampstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Illegally parked, 28th January
item.description:
Your Forest Bike attendant is changing battery packs and seems to think it’s not a problem to park the bikes outside the designated area. These are all in the pay and display bay stopping genuine motorists from finding a pay and display bay. This is not okay. Please removed your bikes.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 28, Church Row, Belsize Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
